Author: IvoryBoneGoddess
Text: He has to understand that you're trying. This is not a magical over night recovery kinda thing. Be honest that you're eating more and genuinely trying,  that you're increasing your intake slowly in the hope that recovery is more likely to stick. This is a lifelong road, there will be set backs and slip ups, try to let your father know that right now you need support and love and focus on your small victories, not anger that you're not "cured". If you're full on ready for recovery try to educate them about the mental illness side of this- all anyone can see is the physical effects,  they can't hear the inner war you're fighting over the smallest amount of calories. Hugs.
